programme.title: Only In
programme.sub-title: Only In: Homemade CEOs, Recycle Bicycle & Pennsyltucky Whiskey in Harrisburg, PA
programme.desc: Where can you find young entrepreneurs, a nonprofit tune-up shop keeping the community safe and a distillery serving up the spirit of Central Pennsylvania? The same place where genius is grown and savory ice cream is a tradition.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: Recreating Salmon Yuca Mash vs. Venezuelan Seafood Empanada
programme.desc: In this battle, it's sink or swim. Chef Josiah of Purple Ocean Superfood Bar in Waterford Lakes takes on Chef Daniel of The Moderne in the Mills 50 district. We’ve got a seafood extravaganza on this episode of Blind Kitchen.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It! Baltimore: Will This Harbor Happy Hour Turn Sour?
programme.desc: It's 5 o'clock in Baltimore! Belly up to the bar and watch Chefs Kevanna Gilmore and Cat Smith battle it out. Who will shake up the competition, and who will end up on the rocks?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Mysterious Slayings in a Wealthy Family
programme.desc: Detectives are baffled after a mother and daughter in an affluent family are murdered outside Louisville. A year later, a triple homicide in North Carolina sends detectives on an explosive search, linking the two cases through an unlikely suspect.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: Highway of Horrors: The Shotgun Slayer Manhunt
programme.desc: In 1977, people across Pittsburgh live in fear as a string of brutal killings sends detectives on a chase to catch the shotgun slayer. He invades homes and senselessly attacks with a shotgun, knives and hammers in the dead of night.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.sub-title: Stitch: Remarkable Birth Stories
programme.desc: Bath tubs, parking lots and living rooms -- sometimes, babies like to make dramatic entrances into the world.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Crimes, Cons and Capers: America's Goofiest Getaways
programme.desc: From stealing an ambulance after leaving a hospital to hijacking a helicopter for the sake of love, these criminals have odd motives and even odder methods of executing them.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.sub-title: Maker Nation Challenge: Indigenous Artists Pay Tribute with Gorgeous Gorgets
programme.desc: Three indigenous makers set out to create a traditional gorget representing their ancestry and Oklahoma City. Tensions rise when an unanticipated addition is brought to the challenge forcing on-the-fly changes. Whose design will soar above the rest?

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.sub-title: Maker Nation: Webs + Pottery
programme.desc: An Omaha home pottery artist, and a spider web-catching jewelry maker in Boston.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: All in the Family
programme.desc: Patrick Shea, Chef and Owner of CK Pearl and Decklyns in Essex and Gloucester and Chef Kladji Plaku, Chef de Cuisine at City Table, City Barn & Solas in Boston engage in a battle of culinary skill. Will a surprise guest judge change everything?

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.sub-title: Eat Play Stay: Smashing Good Times in Des Moines, IA
programme.desc: ‘Fight for your right’ to start the day right with a ‘90s-themed breakfast. Climb aboard a bicycle built for twelve, and cruise between boozy destinations that feature everything from classy cocktails to intoxicating IV bags.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.sub-title: Ed and Day In The ‘Burgh: Park Poses in the Northside
programme.desc: Ed & Day reconnect with their youth, work on their flexibility in an artistic way, and explore local beer culture at Allegheny City Brewing in the Northside.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.sub-title: Heroes On Call: The Forgotten Story of America's First Paramedics
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.sub-title: Ballin' in Baltimore: Expert Photographer Devin Allen Shows Angel Baltimore Through His Lens
programme.desc: Angel captures a different angle on Baltimore with activist and photojournalist, Devin Allen. They explore street photography, pop wheelies with a cutting-edge community dirt biking program and enjoy Charm City's most decadent treats.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.sub-title: Show Me Milwaukee : Laughs on Tap, Fuel Café & a Secret Agent Pub
programme.desc: Greg meets up with Milwaukee Comedy Festival co-founder, Matt Kemple, for an unforgettable night in the life of a comedian. Greg hosts his first comedy show, elevates late night brunch and tests out his improv skills after a grand secret entrance.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It! Baltimore: Food Fit for Grandma's House
programme.desc: To Grandma's House we go! Chefs Mike Boggs and Nancy Longo face off, cooking up their favorite family recipes, but can they remember how Grandma used to make it?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: Double Amputee’s Inspiring Ride
programme.desc: Three years after his double amputation, Jeff in Albuquerque is ready to reconnect with nature. Kinga is there to root him on as he takes on challenging and inspiring outdoor adventures.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Drake Diner Slayings
programme.desc: It's the day after Thanksgiving 1992 in Drake, Iowa, and few want to cook. Locals head to the popular Drake Diner instead. In front of a packed restaurant, an armed man shoots and kills two diner employees. Is the town as peaceful as some say?

programme.title: Only In
programme.sub-title: Only In: Homemade CEOs, Recycle Bicycle & Pennsyltucky Whiskey in Harrisburg, PA
programme.desc: Where can you find young entrepreneurs, a nonprofit tune-up shop keeping the community safe and a distillery serving up the spirit of Central Pennsylvania? The same place where genius is grown and savory ice cream is a tradition.

programme.title: WGAL Local News
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: Get the latest local news and weather from WGAL.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.sub-title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and “butts up” shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.sub-title: Stitch: Unplanned Bonds, Lasting Ties
programme.desc: New connections form in the most unlikely places. In this episode, chance encounters forge lasting friendships and transformative relationships.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.sub-title: Ed and Day in the ‘Burgh: Food Trippin’ in The Strip
programme.desc: Ed & Day get hands on experience baking and cooking as they eat their way through the diverse Strip District ending their day at Cinderlands.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.sub-title: America's Most Delish Midwest: 10 Midwest Holiday Delights to Make Seasons Bright
programme.desc: Celebrate some of the Midwest's holiday favorites. Where scotcheroos take center stage, snicker salads delight, and the pink stuff surprises the pallet.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.sub-title: My Perfect Day with Women's Day: Nurturing Nurse Steps Up To The Front Line For A Day Full Of Surprises
programme.desc: Dedicated mom and nurse, Cleo, spends a day filled with surprises. This incredible mother has overcome obstacles no parent should have to face. Cleo and her sons cook up some quality time.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.sub-title: Blind Kitchen: All's Fair in Love and War
programme.desc: You can feel the love on this week’s culinary showdown. Chef Amy Mehrtens, Executive Chef of Copper Vine, challenges long-time friend Chef Daren Porretto, Chef de Cuisine at Saint John. While these two go back years, when it comes to competition they’re pulling no punches.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.sub-title: Plate It! Sacramento: Going Vegetarian
programme.desc: Seasonal ingredients are the stars of any dish, and Chef Chris Barnum-Dann and Chef Brett Bohlmann prove it in this fully vegetarian episode. Will the judges fawn over their flavors, or will they miss the meat?

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.sub-title: Eat Play Stay: Go Deep into the Laurel Highlands
programme.desc: Thrilling racing action, a treetop dinner, ice cream heaven and a caving adventure.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.sub-title: What's On The Menu, Baltimore? Pretty Plates
programme.desc: We eat with our eyes first! Enjoy these Baltimore chefs crafting some of the most beautiful plates in the city, from a perfect mushroom stew, to an elaborate Venezuelan ceviche.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.sub-title: Matter of Fact: Reuniting Siblings
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact visits a summer camp that’s reuniting siblings separated by the foster care system. Plus, a legal expert explains the impact of the Supreme Court taking on more emergency cases. And, a New York farmer brings fresh produce to underserved communities.

programme.title: Searching for Johnny
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: (2022) The disappearance of Johnny Gosch is one of Iowa's longest running, and most notorious mysteries. In 1982, the 12-year-old paperboy in West Des Moines vanished without a trace. Forty years later, KCCI uncovers where the investigation stands.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.sub-title: On The Job: Brendan Races a LEGO Master
programme.desc: Brendan goes underwater with dolphins and sting rays to learn about ocean conservation, tests his construction skills against a LEGO Master Builder, and preps a theme park dedicated to one of children's most beloved TV characters, Peppa Pig!

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Finding Adventure: Fun Lovin' Love Birds Glide Into Adventure
programme.desc: Soon-to-be-married David and Justin both work long hours in education. When the school year is over, they go abroad for adventure. Kinga shows them there is plenty to do in their own backyard in Cincinnati.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.sub-title: Unbelievable: Rescues From the Brink
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.sub-title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot: Tech N9ne, Chiefs Barber, & Urban Hiker Unveil Their Top Hot Spots
programme.desc: We've got Tech N9ne, the legendary artist who wrote 'KCMO Anthem,' DeJuan Bonds, the barber for the Kansas City Chiefs, and Lisa Peña, a local guide who believes KC is best viewed by foot. You don't want to miss their recommendations!

programme.title: Local Love
programme.sub-title: Local Love: Globetrotting Photographer Looks for a Muse
programme.desc: Eli wants to step out from behind his camera lens and focus on finding a true match. Which of his dates will snap up his attention?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.sub-title: Hometown Tragedy: The Oklahoma Girl Scout Murders
programme.desc: As Girl Scouts at Camp Scott settle into their tents one evening, eerie footsteps and distant cries haunt the campers throughout the night. The unsettling sounds turn out to be the echos one of the largest murder investigations in Oklahoma's history.

programme.title: Always Remember Your Name
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: A documentary of mistaken identity, hope, love, and the power of story by two Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: Chronicle: Bring Them Home
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: (2017) Taken from their reservations, thousands of Native American children underwent an education experiment at the Carlisle Indian Industrial School. WGAL News 8's Matt Barcaro documents the Northern Arapaho's historic attempt to reclaim loved ones.

programme.title: The Roller Coaster Wars That Birthed a Beast
programme.sub-title: The Roller Coaster Wars That Birthed a Beast
programme.desc: In 2006, two dozen roller coaster riders landed in the hospital after a freak malfunction in Ohio. This is the story of Kings Island: how its thrilling – and sometimes nail-biting – history spawned one of America’s greatest amusement parks.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.sub-title: Episode 1
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.
